citation.case_name: Standard Cigar Co. v. Tabacalera Severiano Jorge, SA

html:
376 U.S. 780

84 S.Ct. 1131

12 L.Ed.2d 82

STANDARD CIGAR CO.
v.
TABACALERA SEVERIANO JORGE, S. A.

No. 78.

Supreme Court of the United States

April 6, 1964

William A. Gillen, for petitioner.

Thomas H. Anderson and Herbert L. Nadeau, for respondent.

On Petition for Writ of Certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit.

PER CURIAM.

1

The petition for writ of certiorari is granted. The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit for further consideration in light of Banco Nacional de Cuba v. Sabbatino, 376 U.S. 398, 84 S.Ct. 923.
html_lawbox:
376 U.S. 780 (1964)

STANDARD CIGAR CO.
v.
TABACALERA SEVERIANO JORGE, S. A.

No. 78.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided April 6, 1964.
ON PETITION FOR WRIT OF CERTIORARI TO THE UNITED STATES COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE FIFTH CIRCUIT.

William A. Gillen for petitioner.

Thomas H. Anderson and Herbert L. Nadeau for respondent.

PER CURIAM.

The petition for writ of certiorari is granted. The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit for further consideration in light of Banco Nacional de Cuba v. Sabbatino, ante, p. 398.
